publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4279# Richard Baker: Aberdeen Crossrail—That the Parliament notes the economic, social and environmental benefits that Aberdeen Crossrail would bring to the city and other areas of the north east; welcomes the announcement by Network Rail in April 2006 that an additional £40 million is to be invested in the Scottish rail infrastructure network; considers that this additional investment should be used to help develop projects like Aberdeen Crossrail; welcomes the Scottish Executive’s "Transport for Tomorrow" consultation as a valuable chance to debate the future of the Executive’s transport strategy, and believes that the Executive should, through that strategy, move beyond a feasibility study of the crossrail project and progress towards a commitment to construction with a clear timetable for completion.
S2M-4279# Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 24 April 2006) Rob Gibson*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Maureen Macmillan*, Brian Adam*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-4279# Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 24 April 2006) Patrick Harvie*, Trish Godman*

S2M-4279# Richard Baker: Aberdeen Crossrail—That the Parliament notes the economic, social and environmental benefits that Aberdeen Crossrail would bring to the city and other areas of the north east; welcomes the announcement by Network Rail in April 2006 that an additional £40 million is to be invested in the Scottish rail infrastructure network; considers that this additional investment should be used to help develop projects like Aberdeen Crossrail; welcomes the Scottish Executive’s "Transport for Tomorrow" consultation as a valuable chance to debate the future of the Executive’s transport strategy, and believes that the Executive should, through that strategy, move beyond a feasibility study of the crossrail project and progress towards a commitment to construction with a clear timetable for completion. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Maureen Macmillan, Brian Adam, Shiona Baird, Patrick Harvie, Trish Godman, Marlyn Glen*
S2M-4279# Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 24 April 2006) Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-4279# Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 24 April 2006) Dr Jean Turner*, Mr David Davidson*
S2M-4279# Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 24 April 2006) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-4279# Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 24 April 2006) Robin Harper*
S2M-4279# Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 24 April 2006) Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-4279# Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 24 April 2006) Ms Maureen Watt*

S2M-4279# Richard Baker: Aberdeen Crossrail—That the Parliament notes the economic, social and environmental benefits that Aberdeen Crossrail would bring to the city and other areas of the north east; welcomes the announcement by Network Rail in April 2006 that an additional £40 million is to be invested in the Scottish rail infrastructure network; considers that this additional investment should be used to help develop projects like Aberdeen Crossrail; welcomes the Scottish Executive’s "Transport for Tomorrow" consultation as a valuable chance to debate the future of the Executive’s transport strategy, and believes that the Executive should, through that strategy, move beyond a feasibility study of the crossrail project and progress towards a commitment to construction with a clear timetable for completion. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Maureen Macmillan, Brian Adam, Shiona Baird, Patrick Harvie, Trish Godman, Marlyn Glen, Mr Jamie Stone, Dr Jean Turner, Mr David Davidson, Nora Radcliffe, Robin Harper, Mrs Nanette Milne, Ms Maureen Watt
